business.headline: Explained: Why the IMF is under fire for $1 billion loan to PakistanThe disbursement, approved on Friday under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF), raises total payouts under the programme to $2.1 billion. But the timing of the announcement has provoked a fierce backlash.

India–Pakistan tensions escalate. What's next for Dalal Street investors?While the Sensex and Nifty ended over 1% lower in the previous session, experts suggest that the decline was far less than what could have been expected in such a volatile environment.

Nirmala Sitharama asks banks to stay on alert amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsThe directive comes a day after India successfully intercepted multiple missile and drone attacks launched from Pakistan late on May 8. While India reported no major damage, the government has since asked all critical institutions to bolster their cybersecurity infrastructure in anticipation of potential retaliatory attacks.
'Unsupportive stance towards India': Go Homestays ends ties with Turkish AirlinesGo Homestays ends ties with Turkish Airlines after Turkey backs Pakistan following 'Operation Sindoor'.

India-Pak tensions: Oil PSUs assure ample fuel stocks, urge against panic buyingIndian oil companies have issued statements assuring ample fuel stocks across the country. The Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited have emphasised that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, CNG, or LPG.

Bharti Airtel in talks to acquire 49% stake in Haier India: ReportSunil Mittal, the billionaire-founder of Indian telecom operator Bharti Airtel, has partnered with private equity firm, Warburg Pincus to buy a substantial stake in Haier India.

Telecom regulator recommends 5-year satellite spectrum allotment: ReportThe move comes amid growing interest in satellite internet services from global players like Elon Musk's Starlink and domestic telecom giants.
Sensex closes 880 points lower, Nifty above 24,000; Titan ends 4% upThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 880.34 points to end at 79,454.47, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 265.80 points to close at 24,008.00.

Essential goods supply to remain unaffected across India amid geopolitical heatPrices of key food items, including pulses and vegetables, are being watched closely to make sure they stay under control. Efforts are also being made to keep the supply of these items steady across all cities.

Planning an FD in 2025? Check these 6 banks offering attractive interest ratesFor fixed deposits between 15 and 21 months, HDFC Bank is offering 7.05% to general citizens, while senior citizens get 7.55%

Finance Minister to review cyber readiness of banks, financial institutionsThe meeting will bring together representatives from several key institutions like the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), the National Stock Exchange (NSE), etc.
Explained: Why Yes Bank share price jumped over 7% todayThe Yes Bank stock has now gained nearly 11% over the past five sessions, sparking investor curiosity.

entertainment.headline: Mahesh Babu to share stage with Rajamouli, Jr NTR, Ram Charan at RRR London eventMahesh Babu will join the 'RRR' team members SS Rajamouli, Jr NTR and Ram Charan at the Royal Albert Hall in London on Sunday. Composer MM Keeravaani will perform with a live orchestra at the 'RRR' screening.

Samantha on having 'worst thoughts' over divorce, health issues: Didn't act on themActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu, in a recent interview, talked about having the 'worst possible thoughts' for a year. She further added that she chickened out and didn't want to act on these thoughts.

Aamir Khan, Ranveer Singh and celebs remember makeup artist Vikram GaikwadPopular Bollywood makeup artist Vikram Gaikwad died on Saturday. Aamir Khan, Ranveer Singh, Anushka Sharma and several others paid tribute to him.

Sanam Teri Kasam's directors say no more engagement with Pak actors: Nation first'Sanam Teri Kasam' directors Radhika Rao and Vinay Sapru, in an interview, stated that no one from India should work with Pakistan actors. The duo lashed out at Pakistan actors for their statements against Indian Armed Forces and Operation Sindoor.

Salman honours 'best mothers', Allu Arjun's sweet wishes: Celebs on Mother's DayIndian cinema's biggest stars, Salman Khan, Allu Arjun and several others honoured their mothers on Mother's Day on their respective social media pages. From heartfelt photos to emotional messages, the film fraternity celebrated the special day with love and gratitude.

Preity Zinta is 'finally home', apologises to Dharamshala match crowd: Was bit curt Actor and Punjab Kings owner Preity Zinta shared a long note on X, announcing that she had reached home safely. She also apologised for turning down the crowd at the Dharamshala stadium when they asked for a picture.

Shehzad Khan criticises paparazzi culture: People with no talent chase the papsVeteran actor Shehzad Khan spoke against the growing paparazzi culture dominating the entertainment world. He highlighted the importance of talent and privacy over public spectacle in his exclusive interview with India Today Digital.

Govinda's wife Sunita Ahuja says any 'stupid woman' can't make him 'leave family'Bollywood couple Govinda and Sunita Ahuja released in a statement that they had been working on their marriage after rumours of their divorce went viral earlier this year. Now, Sunita spoke to the media to clarify the rumours.

Rajinikanth congratulates PM, Amit Shah and armed forces for successful Op SindoorSuperstar Rajinikanth congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah and our armed forces for striking terror bases in Pakistan. He also spoke highly of our army, navy and airforce.

Neil Nitin Mukesh on young actors: All of them are upping their game | ExclusiveNeil Nitin Mukesh shares his admiration for young Bollywood actors, naming Vicky Kaushal, Kartik Aaryan and others as promising talents. He also reflects on recent films that impressed him and his passion for watching movies.

Ranveer Allahbadia deletes post for 'Pakistani brothers-sisters' after backlashPodcaster Ranveer Allahbadia is at the centre of a new controversy for making an Instagram post addressed to 'dear Pakistani brothers and sisters' amid India's Operation Sindoor against terrorism. He deleted the post later following criticism on social media.

Samantha says fans asked her for a pic on the day my dad died: I never say noActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu, in a recent interview, talked about how she never says no when fans ask her for a picture. She recalled the incident when a fan approached her for a photo when she was on her way to Chennai to attend her father's funeral.

Ram Charan's wax statue with pet dog Rhyme unveiled in London. WatchRam Charan and his pet dog, Rhyme's statues, were unveiled in London. Their statues will be kept on display at Madame Tussauds Singapore.

She moves mountains for her children: Bollywood celebs share what a mother meansCinema has been celebrating motherhood since its inception in India. And every shade of motherhood finds a place in Indian films. On International Mother's Day 2025, we asked Bollywood celebs how they define a mother.

Ace trailer: Vijay Sethupathi powers through heist film with style and swagActors Vijay Sethupathi and Rukmini Vasanth have joined hands for director Arumugakumar's heist thriller. The trailer was launched by Sivakarthikeyan on Sunday.

Actor Ravi Mohan, rumoured partner Kenishaa attend reception amid heavy trollingActor Ravi Mohan and his rumoured partner Kenishaa made yet another public appearance at producer Ishari Ganesh's daughter's wedding reception in Chennai. This comes a day after the two were trolled for their appearance amid Ravi's divorce battle with wife Aarti.

Samantha recalls 'shaking' on Oo Antava sets: Who thinks of me for a special song?Samantha reminisced about dancing in front of '500 junior artistes' on the sets of the 'Oo Antava' song in 'Pushpa'. She said she took it as an opportunity and did it even when she was 'shaking' out of nervousness.

Taylor Swift's team blasts Justin Baldoni over subpoena in Blake Lively caseThe representatives of Taylor Swift's team talked to the media and criticised actor Justin Baldoni for involving her in his lawsuit against Blake Lively. The team called this a 'tabloid clickbait move'.

Did Salman Khan make a post on India-Pakistan ceasefire and later delete it?Several screenshots of Salman Khan's X-post about the India-Pakistan ceasefire are going viral on social media. It seems like the Bollywood superstar posted about the ceasefire on Saturday and deleted it later.

general news.headline: Indian Navy was in position to strike Karachi, reveals Vice Admiral on Op SindoorIndia launched Operation Sindoor on May 7 against the terror hideouts inside Pakistan and POK in retaliation to the Pahalgam attack. Indian forces destroyed major terror infrastructure in precision strikes.

India releases names of Pak Army personnel, cops who attended terrorists' funeralVideos and images of the funerals of terrorists surfaced on social media, showing several Pakistani Army officials and personnel attending the terrorists' last rites in different parts of border areas.

'Just a trailer': Ex-Air Chief Marshal on India's strikes in Pak terror campsRetired Air Chief Marshal RKS Bhadauria described India's Operation Sindoor as an 'immense success' that achieved all its targets, and called it just a 'trailer' of what India is capable of if provoked further.

Few Pak jets downed, no wreckage as planes stopped from entering: IndiaIndia shot down several advanced Pakistani jets and inflicted significant losses while thwarting a military escalation following Operation Sindoor.

A dangerous India-Pak asymmetry amid fragile truceThere's a dangerous asymmetry between India and Pakistan. While India is led by a civilian leadership that will keep citizen's best interests in mind, Pakistan's real ruler is General Asim Munir, who could go to any extent to satisfy the deep state. This is crucial as a tenuous truce, tested within hours by Munir's men, takes effect.
Satellite image shows damage to Pak's Nur Khan air base in Indian strikeNur Khan air base is home to Pakistan's main transport squadrons and is used for logistical and strategic airlift operations.

Barcelona cleansweep Real Madrid in 2024-25, win 7-goal thrillerBarcelona overcame a 0-2 deficit to defeat Real Madrid 4-3 in a thrilling LaLiga match. This win strengthens their lead and boosts hopes of clinching the LaLiga title despite recent Champions League disappointment.

What India said on avoiding use of 'ceasefire' amid tensions with PakEven as Trump hailed the agreement as a ceasefire, neither India nor Pakistan used the term. Hours after an understanding was reached, Pakistan violated it with heavy firing and shelling towards India.

Watch: Before and after India's missile struck key terror camps in PakistanThe Armed Forces showed detailed missile impact videos from the operation, including visuals of successful strikes on terror camps at Muridke and Bahawalpur.

IC-814 hijackers, Pulwama attackers among 100 terrorists killed in Op SindoorIndia's Operation Sindoor targeted Pakistani terror camps and eliminated several high-value terrorists, including those involved in the 1999 IC-814 hijacking and the 2019 Pulwama attack.
5 Indian soldiers killed under Operation Sindoor, says ArmyThe Indian Army, in a press conference on Sunday, confirmed that five soldiers were killed in Operation Sindoor.

Live: Explosions in Udhampur false, no drones spotted in J&K, says governmentIndia-Pakistan Tension Live Updates: India accused Pakistan of ceasefire violation hours after foreign secretary Vikram Misri announced that India and Pakistan had reached an understanding to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea with immediate effect late on Saturday. However, the situation along the LoC is stable now while western border states are on high alert. PM Modi is currently having a security meeting with NSA Ajit Doval, Defence minister Rajnath Singh, CDS Anil Chauhan and military chiefs. India and Pakistan agreed to halt military actions hours after intense cross-border strikes. The escalation followed India's Operation Sindoor, launched in response to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people.

Can new president Sunny Joseph change Congress future in Kerala?Joseph, a Catholic lawyer and three-term MLA, is seen as a loyalist of outgoing state chief K. Sudhakaran. Will that be his advantage or baggage?

Mohan Yadav wants snake count in Madhya Pradesh, but why it won't be easyIn the absence of an established methodology, the forest department has sought help from the Dehradun-based Wildlife Institute of India

Nearly 40 Pak soldiers killed in LoC strikes during Op Sindoor: IndiaAt least 35 to 40 soldiers from the Pakistani Army were killed between May 7 and 10, the Indian Army said in a press briefing on Sunday.
Don't want any mediation: India amid Trump's Kashmir talks offerOn Trump's offer to India and Pakistan on the Kashmir dispute, New Delhi made it clear that it does not want anyone to mediate.

Salman honours 'best mothers', Allu Arjun's sweet wishes: Celebs on Mother's DayIndian cinema's biggest stars, Salman Khan, Allu Arjun and several others honoured their mothers on Mother's Day on their respective social media pages. From heartfelt photos to emotional messages, the film fraternity celebrated the special day with love and gratitude.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.

If Pak attacks, we will retaliate harder: PM Modi to Vance on ceasefireDuring a phone call with US Vice President JD Vance over de-escalation with Pakistan, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that India would respond strongly if attacked by Pakistan.

Did Pakistan put Australian cricketers in harm's way while striking India?Pakistan has used civilian aircraft as shields while attacking India with drones. Reports that international cricketers took off just hours ago from the Nur Khan military airbase in Rawalpindi before it was hit, tallies with India's charge.

Pak lost every battle, realised they are not in this league: India on Op SindoorOperation Sindoor has sent a clear message to Pakistan, with the country losing every battle against India, government sources said while explaining the outcome of India's military action.

Indus treaty suspension, Op Sindoor: India's 3-point objective against PakWhen it came to serving its military purpose, government sources said that PM Modi set out with a clear objective of razing the terror camps operating from Pakistan to the ground. The May 7 strikes targeted their training and logistical infrastructure, thus achieving PM's "mitti me mila denge" objective.

Pakistan admits to role in Pulwama terror attack amid Pahalgam heatPakistan military admitted to its involvement in the 2019 Pulwama attack, in which 40 CRPF personnel were killed, after years of denial. A top Pakistan Air Force officer publicly called the Pulwama attack "tactical brilliance". The rare admission, made on Friday, amid heat over India's "focused, measured and non-escalatory" Operation Sindoor, exposes the Islamabad-Rawalpindi regime's dirty terror secret.

Mahesh Babu to share stage with Rajamouli, Jr NTR, Ram Charan at RRR London eventMahesh Babu will join the 'RRR' team members SS Rajamouli, Jr NTR and Ram Charan at the Royal Albert Hall in London on Sunday. Composer MM Keeravaani will perform with a live orchestra at the 'RRR' screening.

Samantha on having 'worst thoughts' over divorce, health issues: Didn't act on themActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu, in a recent interview, talked about having the 'worst possible thoughts' for a year. She further added that she chickened out and didn't want to act on these thoughts.

Aamir Khan, Ranveer Singh and celebs remember makeup artist Vikram GaikwadPopular Bollywood makeup artist Vikram Gaikwad died on Saturday. Aamir Khan, Ranveer Singh, Anushka Sharma and several others paid tribute to him.

Sanam Teri Kasam's directors say no more engagement with Pak actors: Nation first'Sanam Teri Kasam' directors Radhika Rao and Vinay Sapru, in an interview, stated that no one from India should work with Pakistan actors. The duo lashed out at Pakistan actors for their statements against Indian Armed Forces and Operation Sindoor.

sports.headline: Arsenal fight back from 2-0 down to secure draw against LiverpoolArsenal fought back from a 2-0 deficit to claim a point against Liverpool at Anfield on Sunday, May 11. Despite going down to 10 men, Mikel Arteta's men showed character to hold on to the point.

Manchester United, Tottenham's Premier League woes continue ahead of Europa finalManchester United and Tottenham Hotspur's woes in the Premier League continued as they lost to West Ham United and Crystal Palace on Sunday, May 11. Both teams will faceoff in the Europa League final on May 21.

Just say India needs you, Virat Kohli will be available: Navjot Singh SidhuNavjot Singh Sidhu has claimed that Virat Kohli will forget about Test retirement and make himself available for the England tour if it is told that India needs him in the side. Sidhu feels Kohli gives balance to the Indian team.

Barcelona cleansweep Real Madrid in 2024-25, win 7-goal thrillerBarcelona overcame a 0-2 deficit to defeat Real Madrid 4-3 in a thrilling LaLiga match. This win strengthens their lead and boosts hopes of clinching the LaLiga title despite recent Champions League disappointment.

Lamine hits calma celebration, mocks Mbappe after scoring vs Real MadridBarcelona wonderboy Lamine Yamal scored a stunning curling goal in the El Clasico match on Sunday, May 11. His celebration echoed Cristiano Ronaldo's iconic 'calma', adding spice to the thrilling contest and taunting rivals.

RCB pacer Hazlewood's return for IPL 2025 in doubt after shoulder injury: ReportJosh Hazlewood's return for the remainder of the IPL 2025 season is in doubt as the Australian pacer is nursing an injury. Hazlewood has been in sensational form for RCB this season.

Jasprit Bumrah opts out of India Test captaincy race ahead of England tour: ReportJasprit Bumrah has opted out of the race to be India's Test team captain, according to a report from Sky Sports. Bumrah has been one of the names that was tipped for the post since Rohit Sharma announced his Test retirement.

India's 4x400m teams miss out on World Championship qualificationIndia's men's and mixed 4x400m relay teams failed to qualify for the World Championships in Tokyo. The teams now aim to secure the remaining berths through upcoming qualification events.

Watch: Hamburg fans invade pitch after Bundesliga promotion, 25 left hospitalised25 fans were left hospitalised after a pitch invasion happened following Hamburg's promotion to the Bundesliga on Saturday, May 10 after they defeated Ulm 6-1. Thousands of fans got on to the field with some suffering serious injuries.

Indian Test team after Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli: Possible squad for EnglandIndia prepares for a major transition ahead of the England Test series starting June 20. The retirement of Rohit Sharma and the possible exit of Virat Kohli marks a new leadership era under Shubman Gill.

Mandhana, Rana star as India hammer Sri Lanka by 97 runs to win tri-seriesIndia beat Sri Lanka by 97 runs in the final to win the tri-series in Colombo. Smriti Mandhana (116 off 101) and Sneh Rana (4/38) emerged as top performers in the commanding victory for the Women in Blue.

Jasprit Bumrah opts out of India Test captaincy race ahead of England tour: ReportJasprit Bumrah has opted out of the race to be India's Test team captain, according to a report from Sky Sports. Bumrah has been one of the names that was tipped for the post since Rohit Sharma announced his Test retirement.

India's 4x400m teams miss out on World Championship qualificationIndia's men's and mixed 4x400m relay teams failed to qualify for the World Championships in Tokyo. The teams now aim to secure the remaining berths through upcoming qualification events.

Watch: Hamburg fans invade pitch after Bundesliga promotion, 25 left hospitalised25 fans were left hospitalised after a pitch invasion happened following Hamburg's promotion to the Bundesliga on Saturday, May 10 after they defeated Ulm 6-1. Thousands of fans got on to the field with some suffering serious injuries.

Indian Test team after Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli: Possible squad for EnglandIndia prepares for a major transition ahead of the England Test series starting June 20. The retirement of Rohit Sharma and the possible exit of Virat Kohli marks a new leadership era under Shubman Gill.

Mandhana, Rana star as India hammer Sri Lanka by 97 runs to win tri-seriesIndia beat Sri Lanka by 97 runs in the final to win the tri-series in Colombo. Smriti Mandhana (116 off 101) and Sneh Rana (4/38) emerged as top performers in the commanding victory for the Women in Blue.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
